SENT.plain: Thirty-one patients aged over 60 yrs and with lupus anticoagulant (LA) were reviewed for their drug intake
Twenty-three (73%) were taking cinchona alkaloids, 10 (32%) quinine for night cramps, 11 (35%) quinidine for cardiac arrhythmia and 2 (6%) were taking both
These frequencies of drugs usage differed significantly from age and sex matched controls (p < 0.001)
Five patients had features suggestive of the antiphospholipid syndrome
Repeat testing showed persistent LA activity in all but 2 of 5 patients in whom the relevant drug had been ceased
This is the first description of a possible causal association between LA and quinine therapy
